segment.source: Identify Applications Settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Identify Applications Settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: Identify Applications Settings
segment.target: Identify Applications Settings

segment.source: Identify Applications Settings
segment.target: Identify Applications Settings

segment.source: When planning for your migration, you should identify which applications and settings you want to migrate.
segment.target: When planning for your migration, you should identify which applications and settings you want to migrate.

segment.source: For more information about how to create a custom .xml file to migrate the settings of another application, see Customize USMT XML Files.
segment.target: For more information about how to create a custom .xml file to migrate the settings of another application, see Customize USMT XML Files.

segment.source: Applications
segment.target: Applications

segment.source: First, create and prioritize a list of applications that to be migrated.
segment.target: First, create and prioritize a list of applications that to be migrated.

segment.source: It may be helpful to review the application lists and decide which applications will be redeployed and which applications will be retired.
segment.target: It may be helpful to review the application lists and decide which applications will be redeployed and which applications will be retired.

segment.source: Often, the applications are prioritized based on a combination of how widely the application is used and how complex the application is.
segment.target: Often, the applications are prioritized based on a combination of how widely the application is used and how complex the application is.

segment.source: Next, identify an application owner to be in charge of each application.
segment.target: Next, identify an application owner to be in charge of each application.

segment.source: This is necessary because the developers will not be experts on all of the applications in the organization.
segment.target: This is necessary because the developers will not be experts on all of the applications in the organization.

segment.source: The application owner should have the most experience with an application.
segment.target: The application owner should have the most experience with an application.

segment.source: The application owner provides insight into how the organization installs, configures, and uses the application.
segment.target: The application owner provides insight into how the organization installs, configures, and uses the application.

segment.source: Application Settings
segment.target: Application Settings

segment.source: Next, determine and locate the application settings to be migrated.
segment.target: Next, determine and locate the application settings to be migrated.

segment.source: You can acquire much of the information that you need for this step when you are testing the new applications for compatibility with the new operating system.
segment.target: You can acquire much of the information that you need for this step when you are testing the new applications for compatibility with the new operating system.

segment.source: After completing the list of applications to be migrated, review the list and work with each application owner on a list of settings to be migrated.
segment.target: After completing the list of applications to be migrated, review the list and work with each application owner on a list of settings to be migrated.

segment.source: For each setting, determine whether it needs to be migrated or if the default settings are adequate.
segment.target: For each setting, determine whether it needs to be migrated or if the default settings are adequate.

segment.source: Then, determine where the setting is located; for example, in the registry or in an .ini file.
segment.target: Then, determine where the setting is located; for example, in the registry or in an .ini file.

segment.source: Next, consider the following questions to determine what needs to be done to migrate the setting successfully:
segment.target: Next, consider the following questions to determine what needs to be done to migrate the setting successfully:

segment.source: Is the destination version of the application newer than the source version?
segment.target: Is the destination version of the application newer than the source version?

segment.source: Do these settings work with the new version?
segment.target: Do these settings work with the new version?

segment.source: Do the settings need to be moved or altered?
segment.target: Do the settings need to be moved or altered?

segment.source: Can the first-run process force the application to appear as if it had run already?
segment.target: Can the first-run process force the application to appear as if it had run already?

segment.source: If so, does this work correctly, or does it break the application?
segment.target: If so, does this work correctly, or does it break the application?

segment.source: After answering these questions, create a custom .xml file to migrate settings.
segment.target: After answering these questions, create a custom .xml file to migrate settings.

segment.source: Work with the application owner to develop test cases and to determine the file types that need to be migrated for the application.
segment.target: Work with the application owner to develop test cases and to determine the file types that need to be migrated for the application.

segment.source: Locating Where Settings Are Stored
segment.target: Locating Where Settings Are Stored

segment.source: See Migrate Application Settings and follow the directions.
segment.target: See Migrate Application Settings and follow the directions.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Determine What to Migrate
segment.target: Determine What to Migrate
